biography:
Chan, Hok-lam, "Chinese Official Historiography at the Yüan Court: The Composition of the Liao, Chin, and Sung Histories," in China Under Mongol Rule, ed. by John D. Langlois (Princeton: Princeton University Press, 1981), p. 74–74.
Chen Yuan.  Western and Central Asians in China under the Mongols: Their Transformation into Chinese.  Trans. and annot. by Qian Xinghai and L.C. Goodrich  (Los Angeles: Monumenta Serica, 1966; reprint ed., Nettetal: Steyler Verlag - Wort und Werk, 1989), p. 23–25.  [xerox in file; includes discussion of his father Pu-hu-mu]
Jiang Yihan files listed under "Kangli Kui." [to be integrated later with this file]
Yu Jianhua ed., Zhongguo meishujia renming cidian (Shanghai: Renmin meishu chubanshe, 1981), p. 803.
Cleaves, Francis Woodman.  "K'uei-k'uei of Nao-nao?"  Harvard Journal of Asiatic Studies 10 (1947), p. 1–12, pls. 1–3.  [xerox in file; definitive study on the artist's name based on a comparison to Mongolian transcription of his name]
Tao Zongyi, Shushi huiyao (1376 ed, rpt. 1929), 7/17b–18a.****
Wang Deyi 王德毅 et al., eds., Yuan ren zhuanji ziliao suoyin 元人傳記資料索引 (5 vols., Taipei: Xinwenfen chuban gongsi, 1980), *** [xerox in file; lists biog. sources]
Yuan shi, comps. Sung Lien et al. (Beijing: Zhonghua shuju, 1976), 143/3413-17.  [xerox in file; lists his name as "Naonao"; also has entry on his brother Huihui]
